name: Llyn Padarn
description: Glacial lake beneath Snowdon with sandy beach entry. Designated bathing water with excellent quality. Can be busy but plenty of space. Cold but stunning.

name: Llyn Gwynant
description: Perhaps Wales's most beautiful lake swim. Campsite access easiest. Snowdon and surrounding peaks reflected in calm water. Cold and clear.

name: Blue Pool (Ceibwr)
description: Natural tidal pool carved into cliffs. Dramatic setting. Access requires care - steep path. Best 2 hours either side of low tide.

name: Llyn Cau
description: Dramatic glacial cirque lake beneath Cadair Idris. Cold and deep. The swim you earn. Minffordd path approach. Take your time.

name: Fairy Glen
description: Series of pools and small falls in wooded gorge. Magical atmosphere. Slippery rocks require care. Can be busy on hot days.

name: Three Cliffs Bay
description: Iconic Gower beach with river crossing. Swim in sea or tidal lagoon. Spectacular limestone cliffs. Check tides - beach floods.

name: Blue Lagoon
description: Flooded slate quarry with striking blue water. Deep and cold. Watch for cliff jumpers. Sheltered from waves. Popular and accessible.

name: Mawddach Estuary
description: Swim near the famous railway bridge with Cadair Idris views. Sandy bottom at low tide. Check tides and boat traffic. Penmaenpool good access.

name: Horseshoe Falls
description: Weir creates swimming pool on River Dee. Canal boats pass above on aqueduct. Historic setting near Llangollen. Can be strong current after rain.

name: Barafundle Bay
description: Often voted Britain's best beach. Walk in keeps crowds manageable. Crystal clear water, soft sand. Worth the walk every time.

name: Swallow Falls
description: Wales's most famous waterfall with pools above and below. Cold but refreshing. Busy viewing area but quieter swimming spots nearby.

name: Llyn Idwal
description: Glacial lake in stunning cirque. Cold even in summer. Devil's Kitchen looms above. Nature reserve - swim with respect. Ogwen start.
